other_tests.findings: Multiple stones are seen layering independently within the gallbladder. The gallbladder is mildly distended with a moderate amount of gallbladder wall edema, compatible with acute cholecystitis. A 6 mm well-circumscribed T2 hyperintense lesion within the pancreatic body likely represents a side branch IPMN. Additional punctate T2 hyperintense lesions throughout the pancreas also likely represent side branch IPMNs.
